metadata.subject: Mueller Investigation Strategy and Potential Presidential Indictment

organizations: U.S. House Committee on Oversight and Accountability

relationships.description: Special Counsel investigating the President for obstruction of justice
Weissmann is Mueller's number two lawyer in the investigation
Trump was considering pardoning his former National Security Advisor
Trump fired Comey as FBI Director over Russia investigation

analysis.purpose: To report on the advanced preparations by Mueller's team to indict President Trump for obstruction of justice
analysis.significance: Reveals internal strategies and legal theories being developed for a potential constitutional crisis involving presidential indictment

concerns: Potential obstruction of justice by the President

notable_quotes: "This indictment could have been drafted without anyone being interviewed," said one source.
"Bob Mueller is all about limits and rules. Donald Trump has none and acknowledges none," said one lawyer who has worked with Mueller in the past.
"Might such an expansive claim win, yes. Should it win, no. But everyone knows the reality: weak presidents lose cases, strong presidents win them," said Ken Starr.
red_flags: President's campaign of harassment, threats, and intimidation against Andrew McCabe
Use of pardon power potentially to obstruct justice
Pressure on officials to fall in line with President's demands
Directing Don Jr. to lie about Trump Tower meeting with Russians

blackmail_indicators.description: No evidence of blackmail or coercion found in this document

illegal_activity.description: Document discusses allegations and legal theories about potential obstruction of justice, but is itself a report about these matters rather than evidence of first-hand illegal activity

details: References to television appearances by Trump legal surrogates
Mentions of public statements and tweets as evidence
Discussion of media strategy and public perception

public_knowledge.context: This document appears to be analysis of the Mueller investigation which was extensively covered in media during 2017-2019

analysis.summary: This document analyzes the Mueller investigation's advanced preparations to indict President Trump for obstruction of justice, detailing the legal theories and strategic considerations involved in what would become a constitutional crisis over presidential powers and immunity.
